Physical x16.Electrical Lanes_comment: Bifurcates to x16/x0 or x8/x8, additional intraslot settings available

Notes.Details: - PCI_E3 (4x4) shares bandwidth with M.2_4 (4x2); it runs at 4x2 if the M.2 slot is occupied. PCI_E3 can also be set to run at x4 in the BIOS, but this will fully disable M.2_4. Also bifurcates x16/x0 or x8/x8; addl. intraslot options available. - The USB4 ports share bandwidth with M.2_2 (5x4); they run at 5x2 (in reality, likely 4x2 since ASM4242 operates on a PCIe 4.0x4 interface by default) if M.2_2 is occupied in x2 mode. M.2_2 is also disabled with Phoenix 2 CPUs. - If M.2_2 is set to x4 in the BIOS, the USB4 ports are fully disabled (or vice versa, if the USB4 is set to take all 4 lanes.)

VRM configuration.VRM (VCore)_comment: VCore: MPS MP87670 (80A) SoC: MPS MP87670 (80A)

Notes.Details: - The USB4 ports share bandwidth with M.2_2 (5x4); they run at 5x2 (in reality, likely 4x2 since ASM4242 operates on a PCIe 4.0x4 interface by default) if M.2_2 is occupied in x2 mode. M.2_2 is also disabled with Phoenix 2 CPUs. - If M.2_2 is set to x4 in the BIOS, the USB4 ports are fully disabled (or vice versa, if the USB4 is set to take all 4 lanes.)  - PCI_E3 (4x4) shares bandwidth with M.2_3 (4x2); it runs at 4x2 if M.2_3 is occupied in x2 mode. If PCI_E3 is set to x4 in the BIOS, this will fully disable M.2_3.

VRM configuration.Phase config_comment: PWM Controller: XDPE192C3B  Under the VRM section on this motherboard's page, it advertises a "Twin" design. However, this is not reflected anywhere else on the page like in other parallel phase boards, so that single mention is likely an oversight on Gigabyte's part.  Given that the Infineon PWM controller supports up to 12 phases before needing to be doubled, and the fact that most ITX boards use a direct configuration, this board is being treated as an (8+2, Direct) configuration.
